basics.name: Thomas Ringling
basics.label: Software Developer
summary: Living north of Copenhagen with my wife and my daughter.
Lifetime learner and polyglot software craftsman with a great love for physical training, music and nature.
A long experience implementing and teaching agile methodologies and principles.
With over 19 years of experience on software development, I span a variety of different technologies, paradigms and programming languages.
I have had many roles within and outside IT, such as developer, coach, teacher, architect, project manager, scrum master, product owner and team lead
As I still do software development, I keep up with new technologies and therefore thrive in environments and cultures who value competences, innovation and creativity.

achievements._description: Contains a list of additional information about the various achievements of an individual, such as participation to conferences, workshops, memberships to organisations, list of publications, etc.

list.title: Agile principles and software development practices

skills.name: Docker
skills.description: I use it in production, but mostly for development and when I try new stuff

skills.name: RabbitMQ
skills.description: My goto message broker, be it via Docker, CloudAMQP or on-prem. Programmed in Erlang ;)

skills.name: ActiveMQ
skills.description: Used it in a PoC, a nice alternative to RabbitMQ

skills.name: DB2
skills.description: Only used it as a developer, never tried to set-up one

skills.name: Oracle
skills.description: Used it in school and on some of my jobs

skills.name: Mysql/MarieDB
skills.description: The first RDBMS I ever installed

skills.name: MSSQL
skills.description: The preferred RDBMS when in .NET-country.

skills.name: CouchDB
skills.description: I love the change feeds, db replication, stability and REST API of this NoSQL DB. Also programmed in Erlang ;)

skills.name: MongoDB
skills.description: Fast NoSQL

skills.name: Redis
skills.description: Key-value store with good query capabilities. Used as an alternative to Memcached

skills.name: Memcached
skills.description: Key-value store cache

skills.name: ElasticSearch
skills.description: NoSQL and Not_Only_A_Database. Do not get tempted to use it as a DB, use it as a super fast search engine backed by real persistent store

skills.name: PostgreSQL
skills.description: My preferred open-source RDBMS database

skills.name: Ruby on Rails(RoR)
skills.description: My first meeting with Ruby and the power of metaprogramming

skills.name: Phoenix
skills.description: A functional web framework build on Elixir. Simplicity, stability, distribution, channels and performance baked in. Some things, just come with the language and platform(VM) itself

skills.name: Vue.js
skills.description: Adopted this framework very early, as it combines the simplicity of Ractive.js and a bunch of the good features from Angular, React and even Elm

skills.name: Elm
skills.description: After working with javascript for many years, I like the purity of a Haskell-like language and the 'no runtime errors' part

skills.name: Angular
skills.description: Been working with AngularJS and Angular

skills.name: Ractive.js
skills.description: Lightweight javascript framework. Even though I primarily use Vue.js now, I like the simplicity of Ractive.js

skills.name: Ruby
skills.description: My goto scripting language. Also using Crystal(https://crystal-lang.org/) combining performance and Ruby expressiveness

skills.name: Elixir
skills.description: My goto dynamic, functional, distributed language. Together with Erlang, Elixir opened my eyes for the world of distributed systems

skills.name: .NET
skills.description: C# is 'Lingua franca' in the .NET world. But you should take a look at F# as well.

skills.name: Java
skills.description: Learned it in school and have been using Java throughout my professional carrier. The list of java technologies I have used is long and much of it outdated, so I will not try to sum it all up here

skills.name: Javascript
skills.description: As I have been doing a lot of frontend development, there is no way to get around this one

skills.name: Typescript
skills.description: Java/C# in the frontend

skills.name: Windows
skills.description: Windows 3.1, 3.11 and so on :o)

skills.name: Linux
skills.description: Together with OS X, Ubuntu is my primary development OS. RedHat, Ubuntu, CoreOS, Raspbian, Mandrake, Debian

experiences.title: Consultant
experiences.roles: Product Owner, Scrum Master, Architect, Software Developer
experiences.summary: Developer, architect, product owner, scrum master and daily manager of the development team
experiences.full:
Product Owner
Jul 2014 – May 2015

My role was primarily Product Owner, but I also acted as SW architect and daily manager of the development team. Hereunder performing recruitment of further staff and coaching of the new scrum master. I furthermore facilitated all workshops within the company

Projectmanager/Scrum Master
Feb 2012 – Jul 2014
Scrum master/Project manager/Facilitator: Responsible for introducing the agile transformation via SCRUM to the development team and the rest of the company.
SW architect: Designing the new distributed architecture in cooperation with the dev team.
Developer: Ruby(on Rails), Elixir/Erlang
